title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allocate unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation is first given to facilities placed in service before that date and then to facilities placed in service after that date. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allocate unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. The term 'unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation' refers to the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the aggregate amount allocated before January 1, 2021. This allocation is coordinated with other provisions and treated similarly to an allocation of national megawatt capacity. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allocate unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation is treated similarly to an allocation of national megawatt capacity, and certain public entities can transfer credits under subsection (a) for taxable years. For taxable years, a qualified public entity can elect to transfer credits to an eligible project partner. The partner will then be treated as the taxpayer for the credit. A qualified public entity includes government entities, mutual electric companies, and not-for-profit electric utilities. The term 'eligible project partner' refers to individuals involved in the design, construction, or provision of components for an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for tax credits. This includes government entities, mutual electric companies, and not-for-profit electric utilities. The advanced nuclear power facility eligible for tax credits includes individuals involved in providing nuclear fuel, ownership interests, and partnerships with special rules for credit determination. The tax credit rules for eligible project partners in partnerships involve the timing of credit utilization and the treatment of transfers under private use rules. Special rules apply to mutual or cooperative electric companies. The amendment under subsection (a) regarding unutilized limitation amounts takes effect upon enactment. Subsection (b) amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016, specifically for mutual or cooperative electric companies. The amendment under subsection (a) takes effect upon enactment, while the amendments under subsection (b) apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
